description.narrative: Schools' resilience and pupils' safety is enhanced through improved disaster preparedness and response, including a rapid reopening of schools after an emergency/disaster, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, more girls and boys are enrolled, retained and learning in pre-primary and primary schools, and there are fewer children out of school.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Schools? resilience and pupils? safety is enhanced through improved disaster preparedness and response, including a rapidreopening of schools after an emergency/disaster

description.narrative: Madagascar is a prone to disasters and has fragile communication and infrastructure systems. These situations have been further complicated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Some activities suffered delays, although they were then prioritized during the post-confinement period. The needs of pupils affected by cyclones, floods and drought have been addressed reaching more than 1,800 schools. Response to the COVID-19 pandemic has had a national-level reach by promoting access and reintegration of out-of-school children.;; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:12/01/2021
